item.title: Defining Services
item.description: Using a dependency injection container is beneficial for bootstrapping Backslash applications. The number of components and their dependencies makes a container practical for managing instantiation and wiring.

item.title: Registering Handlers
item.description: The boot process registers commands with the dispatcher and events with the event bus, establishing the routing between messages and their handlers. This registration happens after service definitions are loaded but before the application handles any requests or executes commands.

item.title: Using the Bootstrap File
item.description: The bootstrap file provides a single entry point for configuring your container and booting your application. This file can be included in CLI scripts, web applications, and tests to ensure consistent initialization.
